data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in Search
data.Description: A federal judge ruled that Google has a monopoly in the search market and illegally maintained its dominance by paying billions of dollars to companies like Apple to secure its position as the default search engine.

data.Title: Apple Rejects Bing, Even if Free
data.Description: Apple executives have stated that they would not replace Google with Bing as the default search engine on iPhones, even if Microsoft paid them or gave them the entire company. They cite Bing's poor quality and lack of ad revenue as reasons.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be transitioning the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns over the coming months. Google claims that "Performance Max provides all the same benefits of Smart campaigns and more."

data.Title: Google Business Profiles Performance Report Missing Call Data
data.Description: The Google Business Profiles performance report is no longer displaying the "call" tab, which provided data on calls generated from Google Search and Maps. This is suspected to be related to the recent removal of Google Business Profile call history.

data.Title: Google Search Console Launches Recommendations Feature
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new feature called "Recommendations." This experimental feature will provide website owners with personalized SEO recommendations based on data from Search Console.

data.Title: Google Ads Issues Credits for Serving Ads with Incorrect Product Data
data.Description: Google Ads experienced a significant reporting outage on August 1st due to a bug that caused ads to be served with product data from other Google Merchant Center accounts. Google has acknowledged the issue and will be issuing credits to affected advertisers.

data.Title: Apple Confirmed to Have a Search Index of Billions of Websites
data.Description: Documents from the Department of Justice's antitrust case against Google have revealed that Apple maintains its own search index containing billions of websites, though the exact number remains redacted.
